item.title: Report E-2024060084
item.description:
Report E-2024060084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN3266 Offense release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 20’ area of the concrete lot below. The pallet tipped over in transit due to improper loading. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and citric acid to neutralize the release. All impacted absorbents and impacted pallets were placed into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060095
item.description:
Report E-2024060095

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 4, 2024, two (2) 50-pound bags of lithium hydroxide were torn in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the lithium hydroxide-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060041
item.description:
Report E-2024060041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-13T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: SALT LAKE CTY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 30, 2024, eight (8) one-gallon pails of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately 0.2 gallons of product to the trailer floor and cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails and all impacted material were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060073
item.description:
Report E-2024060073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1123 were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1123-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, as well as the impacted pallet, and damaged product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums which were staged onsite for future disposal.
